sentences.en: Captain Bowen permitted himself one cigar a day.
sentences.cn: 鲍恩上尉破例允许自己每天抽一支雪茄。

sentences.en: He flicked the ashes from his cigar.
He paused to stub out the butt of his cigar.
sentences.cn: 他停下来，踩灭了手中的烟头。

sentences.en: He reached into his breast pocket for his cigar case.
sentences.cn: 他把手伸进胸前口袋里拿雪茄烟盒。

sentences.en: He sat down, lit his cigar and clapped his hands rather gloomily.
sentences.cn: 他坐了下来, 点着了雪茄,不高兴地拍了三下手板.

sentences.en: He usually has a cigar vised in his teeth.
sentences.cn: 他通常用牙齿叼着一支雪茄.

sentences.en: He was sitting alone at a table in a wine bar, smoking a big cigar.
sentences.cn: 他独自一人坐在酒吧的一张桌旁，抽着一支大雪茄。

sentences.en: He was sitting alone, smoking a big cigar.
sentences.cn: 他独自坐在那儿，抽着一只大雪茄。

sentences.en: He was smoking a big cigar.
He would go around to Fitzgerald and Moy's and get a cigar.
sentences.cn: 他要到费莫酒家来根雪茄.

sentences.en: I don't smoke cigarettes, but I'm not averse to the occasional cigar.
sentences.cn: 我不吸烟, 但我不反对偶尔抽一支雪茄.

sentences.en: I like to smoke a big cigar every now and then.
sentences.cn: 我喜欢不时地抽一支大雪茄.

sentences.en: She handed the cigar back to Jason with a self-satisfied smile.
sentences.cn: 她得意地笑着把雪茄给贾森递了回去。

sentences.en: The old man is sucking at a cigar.
Your breath reeks of stale cigar smoke.
sentences.cn: 你满嘴都是难闻的雪茄味。

phrases.tran_cn: (北美，非正式)（尝试）几乎而未真正成功

trans.tran_en: a thick tube-shaped thing that people smoke, and which is made from tobacco leaves that have been rolled up
